title: NBL 2017 play-offs fixture, teams, Perth Wildcats streak | Cairns Post
text:
5. New Zealand Breakers — 14-14 
6. Melbourne United — 13-15 
7. Sydney Kings — 13-15 
8. Brisbane Bullets — 13-15 
The final ladder is telling, with the three of the four teams qualifying for the post-season among those with the lowest budgets in the league. 
The NBL semi-finals series’ will be held from February 16-24. Both of the semi-finals will be best of three. 
Adelaide 36ers vs Illawarra Hawks 
Game 1: Thursday, February 16 – Titanium Security Arena at 7pm local (7.30pm AEDT) 
Game 2: Sunday, February 19 – WIN Entertainment Centre at 3pm (AEDT) 
Game 3: Thursday, February 23 (if required) – Titanium Security Arena at 7pm local (7.30pm AEDT) 
Cairns Taipans vs Perth Wildcats 
Game 1: Friday, February 17 – Cairns Convention Centre at 6.30pm local (7.30pm AEDT) 
Game 2: Monday, February 20 – Perth Arena at 6:30pm local (9.30pm AEDT) 
Game 3: Friday, February 24 (if required) — Cairns Convention Centre at 6.30pm local (7.30pm AEDT) 
The NBL Grand Finals series will be held between February 27 and March 12, with the winner crowned the 2017 NBL Champions. 
Every game of the NBL finals will be broadcast live and in HD on Fox Sports 3
